problem_text:
∗13.43. (G. R. Robinson). Let G be a finite group and B be a p-block of characters
of G. Conjecture: If the defect group D = D(B) of the block B is non-abelian, and
if |D : Z(D)| = p^a, then each character in B has height strictly less than a.
G. R. Robinson’s comment of 2020: the conjecture is proved mod CFSG for p ≠ 2
in (Z. Feng, C. Li, Y. Liu, G. Malle, J. Zhang, Compos. Math., 155, no. 6 (2019),
1098–1117).
J. Olsson
∗The conjecture is proved (R. Kessar, G. Malle, J. London Math. Soc. (2), 111,
no. 2 (2025), Article ID e70076, https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.13510).
answer: The conjecture is proved (R. Kessar, G. Malle, J. London Math. Soc. (2), 111, no. 2 (2025), Article ID e70076, https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.13510).
